author: beetrootkid
content: Hi there. I'm just taking a look at EIP-7002 and inevitably flipping back to look at `partial-withdrawals` in EIP-7251. I think I'm looking at the latest spec (https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/a7fb2260ae2ea39bdd31886832c9e45452d0e76a/EIPS/eip-7251.md) and I noticed there was this scenario was written in it (in pink). I would've thought that it should 84 rather than 68? I always thought that auto-exit was only triggered once validator balance reached (or went below) 16 ETH... ?

author: pulp1559
content: Hi all, are partial withdrawals available only via EL? Or is it possible via CL message like voluntary exits?

author: jtraglia
content: Hey Kuhan, you can only make partial withdrawals for "excess balance" which is defined as the balance greater than the `MIN_ACTIVATION_BALANCE` (32 ETH). So the 68 ETH figure is correct here. See here for more details: https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/a09d0c321550c5411557674a981e2b444a1178c0/specs/electra/beacon-chain.md?plain=1#L1497

author: jtraglia
content: That's a good question. I could be wrong but I'm pretty sure partial withdrawals (for specific amounts) are only available via EL.

author: beetrootkid
content: um... but then how do you trigger a full withdrawal with the EL withdrawal request?

author: pulp1559
content:
<@502776248741658627> if I'm reading the spec correctly, you can specify amount=0 in your request it will trigger a full exit. See here: https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/a09d0c321550c5411557674a981e2b444a1178c0/specs/electra/beacon-chain.md#new-process_withdrawal_request
namely `is_full_exit_request = amount == FULL_EXIT_REQUEST_AMOUNT` where `FULL_EXIT_REQUEST_AMOUNT = uint64(0)`
